sense.name: area of damaged, cut tissue on a living body
sense.examples: The soldier received a fatal wound on the battlefield. The nurse changed the bandage on the patient's surgical wound. The bullet caused only a flesh wound in his upper shoulder.

sense.name: a state of emotional hurt
sense.commentary: WOUND[+state][+personal][+emotional][+pain] Note: refers to emotional state of a single individual
sense.examples: John is still licking his wounds after the verbal thrashing he got from Mary. Sally said that seeing the film opened up some old wounds about her failed marriage.

sense.name: the act of injuring, cutting, a living body
sense.examples: The pirate took a fatal wound from the rapier of the ship's captain.

sense.name: social discord or disharmony between groups
sense.commentary: WOUND[+state][+social][+discord][+between_groups] Note: refers to discord among a group of individuals
sense.examples: The candidate's remarks have opened an old wound between factions of the party. But can these old wounds ever heal after 20 years of civil conflict in that nation?
